remarks: If there is an edge in a graph, there are two different vertices in the graph which are connected by this edge, analogous to ~ usgraedg3 and ~ edgprvtx and ~ usgrarnedg .  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 18-Dec-2017.)  (Revised by AV, 9-Jan-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
usgedgimpALT.v $e |- V = ( 1st ` G ) $.
usgedgimpALT.e $e |- E = ( Edges ` G ) $.
usgedgimpALT $p |- ( ( G e. USGrph /\ C e. E ) -> E. x e. V E. y e. V ( x =/= y /\ C = { x , y } ) ) $.
$d C x y $.
$d E x y $.
$d G x y $.
$d V y $.
